title: How to Activate Voicemail on Verizon

methods.name: Activate your Verizon Wireless Voice Mail

steps.headline: Press *86 and then send from your Verizon Wireless device.
steps.description: If you care to activate your voice mail without your personal Verizon Wireless phone, just dial your wireless phone number and your voice mail will answer.

steps.headline: Press the # key to proceed, if you hear a greeting message.
Follow the instructions to create a password, a personalized greeting message, or to change your voice mailbox options.
steps.description: The voice mail features are: 20 messages, 3 minute length per message, and a 21 day hold period on all voice mails.

steps.headline: Download the program to your phone by pressing the messaging icon and then choosing the visual voice mail link.
Select the visual voice mail application on your phone.
steps.description: Upon selecting the visual voice mail program, a screen will display further information regarding the visual voice mail. A screen will appear and ask you if you want to download the application and subscribe to the service.

steps.headline: Launch the visual voice mail after downloading.
Enter your Personal Identification Number.
steps.description: Visual voice mail requires your regular voice mail PIN in order to access it.

steps.headline: Press "Yes" to subscribe to the visual voice mail, if you choose to do so.
steps.description: The service and subscription information will come up on your display.

steps.headline: Read the terms and conditions and select "I Accept" when asked to accept, if you agree to them.
Wait 5 minutes before re-launching the Visual Voice Mail.
steps.description: Your visual voice mail inbox displays your messages on your cell phone screen; an icon will appear upon the arrival of a new voice mail. The messages in your inbox will contain: the number or contact name of the caller, the day, date and time that the message was left, the duration of the message, and if the message is about to be past its expiration date.

text: Activate your Verizon Wireless Voice Mail Press *86 and then send from your Verizon Wireless device. If you care to activate your voice mail without your personal Verizon Wireless phone, just dial your wireless phone number and your voice mail will answer. Press the # key to proceed, if you hear a greeting message.  Follow the instructions to create a password, a personalized greeting message, or to change your voice mailbox options. The voice mail features are: 20 messages, 3 minute length per message, and a 21 day hold period on all voice mails. Activate your Visual Voice Mail Download the program to your phone by pressing the messaging icon and then choosing the visual voice mail link.  Select the visual voice mail application on your phone. Upon selecting the visual voice mail program, a screen will display further information regarding the visual voice mail. A screen will appear and ask you if you want to download the application and subscribe to the service. Launch the visual voice mail after downloading.  Enter your Personal Identification Number. Visual voice mail requires your regular voice mail PIN in order to access it. Press "Yes" to subscribe to the visual voice mail, if you choose to do so. The service and subscription information will come up on your display. Press the "Subscribe" button.  Read the terms and conditions and select "I Accept" when asked to accept, if you agree to them.  Wait 5 minutes before re-launching the Visual Voice Mail. Your visual voice mail inbox displays your messages on your cell phone screen; an icon will appear upon the arrival of a new voice mail. The messages in your inbox will contain: the number or contact name of the caller, the day, date and time that the message was left, the duration of the message, and if the message is about to be past its expiration date.
